choices.text:
### System:
You are an AI assistant that follows instruction extremely well. Help as much as you can.

### User:
create a regex expression to extract a three character code like "1Jn" from a filename in format "57-1Jn.usfm".  The characters can be upper or lower case letters or digits. And the filename extension must be ".usfm".

### Response:


Here's the regex expression to extract a three character code like "1Jn" from a filename in format "57-1Jn.usfm": 

```
\b(57|63|64|65|66|67|68|69)\b(usf|mp3|m4a|ape|wav).*[0-9A-Z](\b|$)\b
```

This expression uses the `meta character class` (MOS) `common` to match any three characters that are either uppercase or lowercase, and end with a digit. The `meta character class` `usf` is used to match the filename extension "usf". Finally, the `meta character class` `[0-9A-Z]` matches any three digits or uppercase letters, followed by the meta character class `$`, which matches the last character of the line. The `\b` boundary markers ensure that the match is only applied to the entire line and not just part of it.
